text.__SUMMARY__: Acacia recurvata, commonly known as the recurved wattle, is a shrub of the genus Acacia and the subgenus Plurinerves. It is native to a small area in the Mid West  region of Western Australia.The dense domed shrub typically grows to a height of 0.6 to 2.5 metres (2 to 8 ft). It blooms in July and produces yellow flowers.
